trial_identification.studytitle: Fortifying day-care meals with desiccated beef liver or micronutrient sprinkles to combat anaemia and micronutrient deficiencies in Brazillian pre-school children
trial_identification.scientifictitle: In Brazillian pre-school children, do desiccated beef liver or micronutrient sprinkles improve micronutrient status relative to placebo as measured by haemoglobin changes

interventions.interventions:
Arm 1. Desiccated New Zealand beef liver (freeze dried cooked) from an 11g sachet to be added to mid-day day-care meals each weekday and to home-prepared meals once per day on holidays for 12 months.
Arm 2. Multi-micronutrient sprinkles (1g sprinkles plus 10g of maltodextrin per sachet) to be added to mid-day day-care meals each weekday and to home-prepared meals once per day on holidays for 12 months. Multi-micronutrient sprinkles contain iron, zinc, selenium, vitamin C, vitamin D, thiamine, riboflavin, niacin, vitamin B6, folate, vitamin B12, copper and iodine.
interventions.comparator: Beef flavoured and coloured maltodextrin from 11g sachet to be added to mid-day day-care meals each weekday and to home-prepared meals once per day on holidays for 12 months.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the changes in hemoglobin concentration to be measured electronically on an automated counter.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the changes in serum ferritin determined using a microparticle enzyme immunoassay ferritin kit
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the changes in serum zinc by atomic absorption spectrophotometry
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the changes in serum selenium by atomic absorption spectrophotometry
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the changes in serum folate by microbiological assay
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the changes in serum retinol by high-performance liquid chromatography
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the incidence rate and average duration (in days) of respiratory-related illnesses, recorded on weekdays by day-care staff and at weekends & holidays by parental recall
Differences in the incidence rate and average duration (in days) of diarrhoeal-related illnesses, recorded on weekdays by day-care staff and at weekends & holidays by parental recall
Differences in the change in height for age Z-score
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the change in weight for age Z-score
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the change in weight for length Z-score
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the change in mean development score based on the Denver II Developmental Screening Test adapted to Brazilian Portuguese.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and at end of 12-month intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Differences in the mean cognitive scores based on the Wechsler Pre-School and Primary scale of intelligence Revised (WPPSI-RI) at 12month follow-up only.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Preschool children aged 36 to 60 months whose parent expect to reside in Salvador for at least the subsequent 14 months
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Preschool children who have evidence of chronic disease

trial_design.concealment: Allocation will involve contacting the holder of the allocation schedule who will be "off-site" in New zealand
trial_design.sequence: Stratification will be by gender and age-group (36 to <48 mo; and 48 to 60 mo). Sequence generation will be performed by permuted block randomisation.

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: Dr. Hugo da Costa Ribeiro Jr MD, PhD,
secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Universidade Federal da Bahia, Rua Dr. Augusto Viana, s/n Canela, CEP: 40110-060 Salvador, Bahia,

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We planned this trial to find out whether adding a small amount of powdered beef liver to day-care meals of Brazilian preschool children from Salvador for 12 months could prevent anemia and micronutrient deficiencies, improve their growth, health, and development in the same way or better than adding a small amount of micronutrients in powder form (Sprinkles).

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Ethics Review Board of the Federal University of Bahia
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Rua Augusto Viano, s/n - Canela, Salvador Bahia cep-40.110.06-
